content.title: Fistula Maturation
content.summary: Arteriovenous fistula maturation is the process by which a newly created fistula develops sufficient size and flow for effective hemodialysis. The 'Rule of 6s' provides objective criteria to assess maturity and readiness for cannulation.
content.definition: The physiologic development of an arteriovenous fistula following surgical creation, characterized by venous dilation, wall thickening, and increased blood flow to support hemodialysis

hemodynamic_changes.pressure_transmission: Arterial pressure transmitted to venous outflow

vascular_remodeling.timeline: Most changes occur in first 6-8 weeks

rule_of_6s.definition: Objective criteria to assess fistula maturity for cannulation

criteria.time: ≥6 weeks since creation (though some use 4-8 weeks)

rule_of_6s.success_prediction: Meeting all criteria predicts successful cannulation

palpation.pulse: Thrill should predominate over pulse; strong pulse only = outflow stenosis

failure_to_mature.incidence: 20-50% of radiocephalic fistulas fail to mature

management.surveillance: Duplex at 4-6 weeks to identify problems

accessory_vein_ligation.indication: Competing side branches reducing main vein flow
accessory_vein_ligation.effect: Redirects flow to primary outflow vein

superficialization.indication: Mature fistula too deep for cannulation (>6mm)

assisted_maturation.outcomes: Assisted maturation salvages 50-70% of failing fistulas

content.statement: Fistula Maturation is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Dialysis-Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Fistula Maturation helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Fistula Maturation include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Fistula Maturation.

definition.@value: The developmental process by which an arteriovenous fistula becomes suitable for hemodialysis cannulation

learning_objectives: Describe the physiologic process of fistula maturation
Apply the Rule of 6s to assess fistula readiness
Identify causes of failure to mature
Recognize when early cannulation may be considered
clinical_pearls: Rule of 6s: ≥6mm diameter, ≤6mm depth, ≥600mL/min flow, ≥6cm length
Strong pulse without thrill = outflow stenosis
20-50% of radiocephalic fistulas fail to mature
Accessory vein ligation can salvage many failing fistulas
Duplex at 4-6 weeks identifies problems early

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
